evan-anza1.description: Memorial Day.  Lake Anza.   A nice outing with Evan and his parents, who we hadn't seen for ages.  The boys were very happy to see each other.  Evan was proud of his new wetsuit, which he called "supersuit!"
evan-anza1.title: Evan Anza 1

evan-anza2.description: We kept Milo in a shady spot with sand toys, away from the water. But he started whining and he did the "water" sign for the second time ever.  He wanted in on the REAL action with Felix and Evan. A little sunscreen and big hat later, he got what he wanted.
evan-anza2.title: Evan Anza 2

evan-puzzle.description: Evan, Felix, and Janice collaborate on a puzzle.  Felix does a lot of puzzles -- we just got a new set of 40-piece puzzles, which are definitely keeping him challenged.
evan-puzzle.title: Evan Puzzle

evan-truck1.description: We haven't met a kid yet that can resist the magical brick path.
evan-truck1.title: Evan Truck 1

evan-truck2.description: Thanks to Mr. Gravity, they can roll unassisted the entire length of the side yard.
evan-truck2.title: Evan Truck 2

evan-yard1.description: Milo is glad to be included with the big boys.  In fact, he insists on it.
evan-yard1.title: Evan Yard 1

evan-yard2.description: Yay for Memorial Day!  The big people grilled salmon, tuna and asparagus; Felix and Evan had hot dogs, corn on the cob, and tea in dainty cups.
evan-yard2.title: Evan Yard 2

group.description:
Big turnout at the yogamoms gathering this week.

Top: Lucie/Milo, Sara/Leo, Celia/Ariel, Sara/Argil, Amy/Eli, Katie/Jaime
Bottom: Kelly/Ruby, Clara/Saia, Patrice/Peter, Jen/Kai.
group.title: Group

jumpoline.description: Felix is rapidly losing his little-kid clumsiness.  He likes to run and jump much more than he used to.  He calls the bean bag his "jumpoline".
jumpoline.title: Jumpoline

noah1.description: Noah (a Snuggery kid) had a birthday party at a gym. It was a lot of fun. Felix and Jasper followed each other around, jumping, running and laughing.
noah1.title: Noah 1

noah3.description:
Jasper is 1 week older than Felix; he started going to the Snuggery the same day as Felix; his sister is almost the same age as Milo; and we all live a few short blocks from each others. No wonder they have become so close!

Felix is going to miss Jasper when he leaves the Snuggery. However, during our visit of the New School, Felix met a boy named Jasper. "That's going to be my new best friend!", exclaimed Felix. We sure hope that new Jasper is as nice as old Jasper.
noah3.title: Noah 3

noah4.description: Why are Albert, Evan and Noah so down?  We can't find any matches to light the birthday candles! It was a very California moment:  20 adults and not a single smoker among them.
noah4.title: Noah 4

playing.description: Toys:  not just for mouthing anymore!  Milo has been branching out in the last two weeks.  He loves to open and close doors, put stuff in and out of boxes, and generally explore how things fit together.
playing.title: Playing

pool.description:
Rub a dub dub, 7 babies in a tub.

From top, clockwise: Saia, Kai, Milo, Eli, Ariel, Gabriel and Argil

Photo by Jen Molander, the professional photographer in our yogamom's group.
pool.title: Pool

description:
Milo added TWO new baby signs this week! We've been modeling baby signs for a few months, but we didn't expect Milo to use them himself so soon. Felix was 14 months-old before he did.
  • [opening and closing mouth]: fish. Milo does this sign every time he passes our fish tank. He also sometimes does it for toy fishes, and today at a fish mural on a wall.
  • [rubbing hands]: running water / bath. One evening, same as every evening, Lucie turned on the bathtub faucets and undressed Milo. But then she took an unexpected detour downstairs to check on something. As they were going down the stairs, Milo rubbed his hands together -- clearly saying "Hey mom! What about my bath?".
Felix is very sweet. Lately he keeps quantifying how much, tall and fast he loves us. A typical exchange:
Felix: Papa, I love you a lot
Dean: Aww, I love you too, Felix!
Felix: I love you in a tree!
Dean: I love you higher than an airplane!
Felix: I love you in a cloud!
Dean: I love you as deep as the ocean!
Felix: I love you faster than a speedboat!

His most ardent declaration of love so far? "Milo, I love you more than my Legos!"

We're reading longer books to Felix. One of his favorites is The Giraffe, The Pelly and Me, which weighs in at 80 pages. It still has pictures, but not many. Towards page 60, Dean starts summarizing a bit.
title: May 30
